org.opentosca.toscana.plugins.cloudformation

Class CloudFormationModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scaleset.cfbuilder.core.Module
      • org.opentosca.toscana.plugins.cloudformation.CloudFormationModule

  • public class CloudFormationModule
extends com.scaleset.cfbuilder.core.Module
    CloudFormationModule is an extension of the Module class. It represents an artifact of CloudFormation. It contains all AWS Resources and their properties added to this module but also holds information about files that need to be uploaded and environment variables that need to be pushed.
    See Also:
    Github page of the cloudformation-builder, CloudFormation, S3 Storage

      • CloudFormationModule

        public CloudFormationModule(PluginFileAccess fileAccess,
                            java.lang.String awsRegion,
                            com.amazonaws.auth.AWSCredentials awsCredentials)
        Sets up the Module which uses the cloudformation-builder to build an AWS CloudFormation template
        Parameters:
        fileAccess - fileAccess to append the content of files to the template
        awsRegion - the region the template will be deployed in
        awsCredentials - the AWSCredentials for connecting with the AWS API

      • getBucketName

        public java.lang.String getBucketName()
        Gets the name of the S3 Bucket that will be created to store files.
        Returns:
        the name of the S3 Bucket
        See Also:
        S3 Storage

      • getAWSRegion

        public java.lang.String getAWSRegion()
        Gets the AWS Region this CloudFormationModule is bound to.
        The CloudFormationModule is bound to a region for following reasons:
        1. Image ids for EC2 Instances are bound to a region.
        Returns:
        the String representation of a AWS Region
        See Also:
        AWS Regions, AWS Regions usage

      • getAwsCredentials

        public com.amazonaws.auth.AWSCredentials getAwsCredentials()
        Gets the AWS Credentials that are connected to the CloudFormationModule.
        The CloudFormationModule needs credentials for:
        1. Connecting to AWS using the AWS SDK to get image ids for EC2 Instances
        Returns:
        the AWS Credentials of this CloudFormationModule

      • getKeyNameVar

        public java.lang.Object getKeyNameVar()
        Gets the key name variable of this CloudFormationModule.
        If a CloudFormationModule has key pair enabled, every instance is set with this key name.
        Returns:
        the key name object

      • hasKeyPair

        public boolean hasKeyPair()
        Checks whether this CloudFormationModule has a key pair.
        Returns:
        return true if it has a key pair

      • addComputeToEc2

        public void addComputeToEc2(Compute compute)
        Marks a Compute node to be transformed to an EC2 instance.
        The transformation is done by the CloudFormationLifecycle.transform() operation.
        Parameters:
        compute - the Compute node that should be marked

      • removeComputeToEc2

        public void removeComputeToEc2(Compute compute)
        Cancels the mark for a Compute node from being transformed to an EC2 instance.
        Parameters:
        compute - the Compute node that should not be transformed

      • checkComputeToEc2

        public boolean checkComputeToEc2(Compute compute)
        Checks if this Compute node is marked to be transformed to an EC2 instance.
        Parameters:
        compute - the Compute node to check
        Returns:
        returns true if the Compute node is marked

      • putCFNInit

        public void putCFNInit(java.lang.String resource,
                       com.scaleset.cfbuilder.ec2.metadata.CFNInit init)
        Puts a CFNInit into a map.
        The CFNInit is linked to the resource and will be added to it at build time. This is done so the CFNInit can be modified.
        Parameters:
        resource - the resource to add the CFNInit to
        init - the CNFInit to add

      • getCFNInit

        public com.scaleset.cfbuilder.ec2.metadata.CFNInit getCFNInit(java.lang.String resource)
        Gets the CFNInit belonging to the given resource.
        Parameters:
        resource - String id of the resource

      • putFn

        public void putFn(java.lang.String key,
                  com.scaleset.cfbuilder.core.Fn value)
        Puts an Fn with its string representation into a map.
        This is done because the EffectiveModel only supports String as values for most properties while the CloudFormation Plugin needs Fn objects which can be used to reference values between resources.
        Parameters:
        key - the string representation.
        value - the actual Fn value

      • checkFn

        public boolean checkFn(java.lang.String key)
        Checks if the key is saved as a Fn object.
        If yes this means at transformation the String should be replaced with the Fn so the toString() works properly.
        Parameters:
        key - the String to check
        Returns:
        returns true if the key is stored in the Fn map

      • getFn

        public com.scaleset.cfbuilder.core.Fn getFn(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the Fn object corresponding to the key.
        Parameters:
        key - the String key to get
        Returns:
        returns the corresponding Fn object.

        the list of files that will be uploaded

      • putAuthentication

        public void putAuthentication(java.lang.String instanceName)
        Marks the instance that it needs authentication to the S3 Bucket. It is put into a map.
        Parameters:
        instanceName - the name of the resource that need authentication

      • getAuthenticationSet

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAuthenticationSet()
        Gets the Set of instance names of resources that need authentication to the S3 Bucket that will be created.
        Returns:
        the set of String instance names of resources that need authentication

      • putEnvironmentMap

        public void putEnvironmentMap(java.lang.String instanceName,
                              java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.String value)
        Puts an environment variable corresponding to a instance into a Map.
        The environment variables get stored in a map where each instance has its own map of environment variables.
        Parameters:
        instanceName - the instance name the environment variable belongs to
        key - the key of the environment variable
        value - the value of the environment variable
        See Also:
        EnvironmentHandler

      • getEnvironmentMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getEnvironmentMap()
        Gets the Map of all instances that need environment variables and their environment variables.
        Returns:
        the map of instances with their corresponding environment variables

      • getTemplate

        public com.scaleset.cfbuilder.core.Template getTemplate()
        Gets the Template of this CloudFormationModule.
        Used to reference things like AWS::StackName using the Template.ref(String) method.
        Returns:
        the Template of this CloudFormationModule

      • getParameters

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,com.scaleset.cfbuilder.core.Parameter> getParameters()
        Gets the parameters of the template belonging to this CloudFormationModule.
        Returns:
        map with the parameters of the template

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Transforms this CloudFormationModule into a String representation.
        The returning String is a valid CloudFormation template. Before the Template.toString(Boolean) method is called with yaml set to true, the build() function is called to prepare the module.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • build

        public void build()
        Build the template.
        Following steps are taken:
        1. Add CFNInit to corresponding instance resource
        2. Check if EC2 instances need access to S3. If yes, then
          1. Add necessary IAM resources to the module
          2. Add Authentication and IamInstanceProfile to corresponding instance resource
        3. Add the KeyPair to the template if it is needed
        Overrides:
        build in class com.scaleset.cfbuilder.core.Module
